comments.body: Could we also have a top-level `def` and a non-top-level `def` in this file that call `hello(Boolean)`?

Hum, I was referring to calling the `def hello(b: Boolean)` that was already defined in `moredefs_1.scala`, to test that overloading resolution can find overloads in other files.

And right now I believe the code *shouldn't* compile, because it shouldn't be able to pick between the `def hello(Boolean)`s that are defined in this file and in `moredefs_1.scala`.
Indeed it did not compile. The test is now as you propose.
